value.name: A list of COVID-19 outbreaks at New England colleges
value.description: Hundreds of college students at New England-area universities have become infected with COVID-19 since returning to campuses across the region this fall.

value.name: Why school COVID-19 outbreak numbers in Michigan seem low
value.description: The State of Michigan's system of reporting school-based COVID-19 outbreaks probably understates the numbers of student and staff who are positive.

value.name: UK universities grapple with spiralling COVID-19 outbreaks
value.description: The University of Glasgow has offered a rent rebate to residents and support with securing food and medical supplies for self-isolating students in a sign of the huge challenge colleges are facing when COVID-19 outbreaks hit campus.

value.name: Michigan State’s COVID-19 outbreak now larger than GVSU’s

value.name: Rabies Hero campaign aims to suppress secondary disease outbreaks due to COVID – 19
value.description: WSU's Rabies Free Africa launched the Rabies Hero campaign today to raise national awareness about potential disease outbreaks in animals as people miss routine veterinary care appointments during COVID-19.

value.name: U.K. students locked down in university dorms as COVID-19 cases rise
value.description: Thousands of students across the UK have been forced into isolation within weeks of arriving for the start of the academic year after mass coronavirus outbreaks were confirmed at university campuses.

value.name: Ministers defend students’ return to university amid rash of Covid-19 outbreaks
value.description: Ministers have defended the return of students to university despite government scientists insisting the rash of outbreaks on campuses in recent days had been predicted back in August. Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden said students would be able to return home to their families for Christmas if the public abides by social distancing rules as he insisted it was important they did not miss out on a year of university.

about.name: Ministers of the New Zealand Government

value.name: Have Public Universities Failed Their Communities On Covid-19 And Racism?
value.description: It is time for university leaders to pay attention to public sentiment and to become more responsive to the wants and needs of the very citizens they are supposed to be serving.

value.name: Covid-19 Live Updates: Murders Climbed in 27 U.S. Cities as the Virus Spread in the Summer
value.description: The world is nearing another tragic threshold in the coronavirus pandemic: a reported death toll of one million people.

value.name: UCSD aims to prevent COVID-19 outbreak as fall quarter begins
value.description: Monday marks the start of fall quarter at UC San Diego, where a number of measures are being taken to prevent an outbreak of COVID-19.

value.name: Case Western Reserve researchers receive $2.3 million to study COVID-19 spread in nursing homes
value.description: Almost from the moment COVID-19 reached this nation's shores, nursing homes have experienced some of its most devastating effects.

value.name: Marquette University students at Cobeen Hall must quarantine for two weeks due to COVID-19 outbreak
value.description: The dormitory is the second at Marquette to be put in quarantine, after administrators placed Schroeder Hall on lockdown beginning Sept. 15.

value.name: UK students are trapped in their dorms, threatened with $1,000 fines if they leave, as universities scramble to prevent COVID-19 outbreaks on campus
value.description: New university students in the UK say they are being prevented from leaving their dorms and threatened with fines as part of heavy-handed attempts by authorities to prevent COVID-19 spreading on campus.

value.name: U.S. records over 7 million COVID-19 cases as Midwest outbreak surges
value.description: The number of novel coronavirus cases in the United States topped 7 million - more than 20% of the world's total - as Midwest states reported spikes in COVID-19 infections in September, according to a Reuters tally.

value.name: Illinois COVID-19: IL reports 1,709 new coronavirus cases, 13 deaths
value.description: Illinois public health officials announced 1,709 new cases of COVID-19 Monday along with 13 additional deaths.

value.name: About 80% of Asymptomatic People With COVID-19 Develop Symptoms
value.description: A meta-analysis from Switzerland and study from South Korea reach the same estimate — that only about 20% of asymptomatic people with COVID-19 remain so over time.

value.name: Michigan State University pushes forward with football amid a mass spike in COVID-19 cases
value.description: Since August 24, there have been 1,250 cases of COVID-19 linked to the reopening of Michigan State University (MSU). The university has officially recorded 499 positive cases, which both the university and the Ingham County Health Department have acknowledged is an underestimation of the true number of cases.

value.name: COVID-19: How do Salisbury University and UMES compare
value.description: Salisbury University and the University of Maryland Eastern Shore sit less than 15 miles from one another, but the effects from COVID-19 have been very different.

value.name: Glasgow University to refund one month’s rent after Covid-19 outbreak
value.description: The return of students to universities has led to a spike in the number of coronavirus cases across the country.

value.name: Elon University reports COVID-19 outbreak among student-athletes

value.name: Opposition mounts at the University of Michigan as COVID-19 outbreaks emerge on campus

value.name: One COVID-19 Shot, Two Approaches
value.description: Just as two heads are proverbially better than one, so two approaches to fighting COVID-19 are likely to double the odds of success against the virus, reasons a Cambridge, MA-based vaccine developer with key operations in Canada and Israel.

value.name: York County has 67 new cases of COVID-19, no new deaths
value.description: Of those cases, 44 were reported Sunday and 23 were reported Monday. There were no new deaths linked to COVID-19 during that time period, leaving the death toll at 156.

value.description: The life-support option known as ECMO appears to help many of the critically ill COVID-19 patients who received it, according to a study led by a University of Michigan researcher.

value.name: Data: King Co. COVID-19 Protocols Kept Providers Safer

value.name: Don’t muzzle scientists investigating COVID-19
